marketNews.title: Rupiah Exchange Rate Weakens Since Early June 2024, Approaching 16,300 Level
marketNews.content: The rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar weakened intraday to penetrate the 16,300 level on Thursday (6/6), marking the weakest level since April 2020, before finally closing slightly stronger by +0.02% at the 16,279 level. Since the beginning of June 2024, the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar has decreased by -0.3% MTD as of Thursday (6/6). The weakening of the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar occurred alongside the weakening of Indonesia's trade balance surplus due to the normalization of commodity prices, fund outflows during the Hajj season, and dividend repatriation by foreign investors investing in Indonesian companies. Since the beginning of June 2024 alone, the Indonesian capital market experienced net foreign outflow, with a net outflow in the bond market reaching 43 billion rupiah as of Tuesday (4/6) and in the stock market reaching 53 billion rupiah as of Wednesday (5/6). Although the rupiah exchange rate weakened against the US dollar since the beginning of this month, the US dollar index (DXY) actually dropped -0.6% MTD to the 104 level as of Thursday (6/6). The weakening of the DXY occurred after the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that job openings in the US in April 2024 reached only ~8.06 million (vs. March 2024: 8.36 million), lower than the consensus expectation of 8.36 million and marking the lowest level since February 2021. Additionally, ADP reported that the number of private company hirings in the US in May 2024 reached only 152,000 (vs. April 2024: 188,000), lower than the consensus expectation of 175,000. In line with weak US employment data, the market is now beginning to expect the Fed to start cutting US interest rates in September 2024. Based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of the Fed starting interest rate cuts in September 2024 reached 78.3% as of Thursday (6/6), up from 59.6% on Monday (3/6). Key Takeaway: The weakening of the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar when the DXY is also weakening indicates that the rupiah's depreciation in June 2024 is not caused by a strengthening US dollar. Furthermore, even though market expectations for the start of US interest rate cuts strengthened, the weakening of the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar makes the direction of the BI Rate policy uncertain, even risking an increase again. The current consensus still predicts a cut in the BI Rate in 4Q24. We assess that Bank Indonesia can implement a cut if inflation remains controlled and the rupiah exchange rate remains stable.

marketNews.title: Asian Emerging Market Stocks Saw Foreign Outflows in May, Driven by Strong US Economic Data
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that emerging market stocks in Asia experienced foreign capital outflows for 2 consecutive months in May 2024, driven by strong US economic data which triggered skepticism about the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts. Reuters noted that stock exchanges in India, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand, South Korea, the Philippines, and Taiwan experienced a net foreign outflow totaling 3.58 billion US dollars in May 2024, following a net foreign outflow of 4.92 billion US dollars in April 2024. Of this total, the Indonesian stock market experienced a net foreign outflow of 881 million US dollars. On the other hand, the Taiwan stock market experienced a net foreign inflow of 2.41 billion US dollars in May 2024, reversing from a net foreign outflow of 4.61 billion US dollars in April 2024, driven by AI development sentiment.

marketNews.title: Ministry of ESDM Notes National Coal Production Realization Still Only 34.6% of Target
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) noted that the national coal production realization as of June 5, 2024, reached 319 million tons, only fulfilling 34.6% of the 2024 target of 922.14 million tons. The Executive Director of the Indonesian Mining Association, Hendra Sinadia, stated that the coal production realization this year will be lower than the target. Hendra mentioned that the coal production realization in 1Q24 was not optimal due to a condition of oversupply in the global market.

marketNews.title: Saudi Aramco Lowers All Crude Oil Prices to Asia for July Amid Demand Concerns
marketNews.content: Saudi Aramco lowered the prices of all its crude oil to Asia for July 2024, marking the first decrease since February 2024. Bloomberg reported that this move was taken amid concerns over weak demand. Through this decision, Aramco will reduce the price of Arab Light crude oil by 50 cents to 2.4 US dollars per barrel above the regional benchmark price. Previously, consensus only expected a decrease in the Arab Light price of 40 cents.

marketNews.title: Nvidia Officially Overtakes Apple as Second Most Valuable Company Globally
marketNews.content: Nvidia (Nasdaq: NVDA) officially surpassed Apple (Nasdaq: AAPL) as the second most valuable company by market capitalization in the world on Wednesday (5/6). Nvidia's market cap currently stands at 3.01 trillion US dollars, higher than Apple's 3 trillion US dollars, but still lower than Microsoft (Nasdaq: MSFT) which reached 3.15 trillion US dollars. Nvidia's stock price itself has surged +216.8% YoY, driven by a surge in demand for chips for artificial intelligence (AI) development needs. Additionally, Nvidia will also conduct a 1:10 stock split, which will be effective on June 7, 2024.

marketNews.title: President Joko Widodo Plans to Start Working from IKN in July 2024
marketNews.content: Indonesian President Joko Widodo said on Wednesday (5/6) that he plans to start working from the new capital city (IKN) in July 2024. President Joko Widodo stated that the first phase of infrastructure development in IKN has reached approximately 80%. President Joko Widodo's statement came just a few days after the government announced that the Head of the IKN Authority, Bambang Susantono, and the Deputy Head of the IKN Authority, Dhony Rahajoe, resigned from their positions for unstated reasons.

tickerNews.title: IMAS Secures US$450 Million Syndicated Loan
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Sukses Internasional through its subsidiary, PT IMG Sejahtera Langgeng, obtained a syndicated loan worth 450 million US dollars. This syndicated loan was led by Bank BTPN (BTPN) and Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, and involved 32 creditors. This syndicated loan has several tranches in its fund usage, one of which is a green financing tranche worth 225.8 million US dollars intended for developing the electric vehicle ecosystem.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Signs Mining Service Agreement Term Sheet with Estimated Value of US$230 Million
tickerNews.content: Petrosea signed a term sheet for a mining service agreement with PT Global Bara Mandiri, where the estimated value of the work reaches 230 million US dollars. The duration of this work is 8 years and can be extended to a life of mine contract.

tickerNews.title: New Controller of CASS, Subsidiary of EMTK, Launches Tender Offer Below Market Price
tickerNews.content: The new controller of Cardig Aero Services and subsidiary of Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), PT Roket Cipta Sentosa, is conducting a tender offer for 359 million (17.2%) CASS shares from June 5 to July 4, 2024. The offering price set is 883 rupiah per share, which is -15.9% lower than the CASS stock price as of Thursday (6/6) at 1,050 rupiah per share. Investors who participate in this tender offer will receive payment on July 16, 2024. Previously, PT Roket Cipta Sentosa acquired 1.06 billion (~51%) of CASS shares valued at 872.8 billion rupiah in April 2024.

tickerNews.title: MIKA to Distribute 2023 Final Dividend of IDR 34 per Share
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat will distribute dividends for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to approximately 483 billion rupiah or 34 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date on the regular and negotiation market is June 12, 2024, with payment on July 5, 2024. Based on MIKA's stock price on Thursday (6/6) at 2,950 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.2%.

tickerNews.title: TOTO to Distribute 2023 Final Dividend of IDR 9 per Share for Total Yield of 4.3%
tickerNews.content: Surya Toto Indonesia will distribute a final dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to approximately 92.9 billion rupiah or 9 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date on the regular and negotiation market is June 11, 2024, with payment on June 28, 2024. Based on TOTO's stock price on Thursday (6/6) at 208 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 4.3%. Previously, TOTO also distributed an interim dividend of approximately 92.9 billion rupiah or 9 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: MD Pictures Commissioner Buys FILM Shares Worth IDR 6.9 Billion
tickerNews.content: MD Pictures Commissioner, Sanjeva Advani, bought 1.65 million FILM shares at a price of 4,200 rupiah per share on May 30, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Sanjeva Advani's ownership in FILM increased from 0% to 0.02%.

tickerNews.title: Mandiri Herindo Adiperkasa CEO Increases Stake in MAHA to 7.96%
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Mandiri Herindo Adiperkasa, Yenny Hamidah Koean, bought 15.5 million MAHA shares at a price of approximately 227.9 rupiah per share on June 5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Yenny's ownership in MAHA increased from 7.87% to 7.96%.

tickerNews.title: Ecocare Indo Pasifik (HYGN) to Distribute Dividend of IDR 2.16 per Share for 1.3% Yield
tickerNews.content: Ecocare Indo Pasifik (HYGN) will distribute dividends for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to 5.45 billion rupiah or 2.16 rupiah per share, equivalent to a 30% dividend payout ratio. The cum-dividend date on the regular and negotiation markets has not yet been announced. Based on HYGN's stock price on Thursday (6/6) at 168 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.3%.
